page.title: 10FARMING IN HATHERDEN
page.content: Richard Noyce is the manager of Dunnings' Farm here in Hatherden.There are 2500 acres divided into fourteen fields but only 200 acres are in our block.In 1958 the land owned by Dunnings was sold by the Capes family and the present Dunnings Farm was bought from some Americans. The farmhouse Mr.Mrs Noyce live in was built in 1729 because a beam has the date engraved on it.This is the time when George the Second was on the throne.That part of the farm in our area is mainly mixed between dairy and cereal. There are 130 Fresian cows in the milking herd and this year barley is their main crop.In the milking shed the tank holds 750 gallons and in a typical day the cows produce 3,000 litres of milk.Twelve men work a five day week on the farm and there are 12 tractors.
